intro: Psychotria hombroniana var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and chemical composition, it has attracted interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological research.
